attributes.description: Specifies the background color of an element.
Defines the color of the text inside an element.
Specifies the font for the text inside an element.
Defines the size of the font.
Sets the margin space around elements.
Sets the padding space inside an element.
Defines the width of an element.
Defines the height of an element.
Specifies the horizontal alignment of text in an element.
Specifies the type of positioning method used for an element (static, relative, absolute, fixed, or sticky).
Specifies if/how an element is displayed.
Sets the opacity level for an element.
Sets the stack order of an element.
Specifies what should happen if content overflows an element's box.

units.description: Pixels: A pixel is a dot on the screen, and it is the smallest visible unit represented on the screen.
Viewport Height: This unit is based on the height of the viewport. 1vh is equal to 1% of the viewport's height.
Viewport Width: This unit is based on the width of the viewport. 1vw is equal to 1% of the viewport's width.
Relative to the font-size of the element (2em means 2 times the size of the current font).
Relative to font-size of the root element.
Points. 1pt is equal to 1/72 of an inch.
Centimeters, millimeters, inches. Used for print media.
